senses.sense_definition: A person who is unfairly blamed for the wrongdoings, mistakes, or faults of others.

examples.text: The manager refused to be made a <w>scapegoat</w> for the errors of his superiors.
They needed a convenient <w>scapegoat</w> to explain the sudden loss of funds to the public.

senses.sense_definition: A goat sent into the wilderness after the Jewish chief priest had symbolically laid the sins of the people upon it, as described in the Bible.

examples.text: In the ancient ritual, the <w>scapegoat</w> carried the sins of the people into the desert.
The high priest cast lots to decide which animal would become the <w>scapegoat</w>.

senses.sense_definition: To unfairly blame or punish a person or group for the mistakes or problems of others.

examples.text: It is common for politicians to <w>scapegoat</w> minorities during economic crises.
We must not <w>scapegoat</w> the junior staff for the failure of the management.
